#Text=Wikinews interviews Frank Moore , independent candidate for US President
#Text=Saturday , March 1 , 2008

#Text=While nearly all coverage of the 2008 Presidential election has focused on the Democratic and Republican candidates , the race for the White House also includes independents and third party candidates .
#Text=These parties represent a variety of views that may not be acknowledged by the major party platforms .
#Text=Wikinews has impartially reached out to these candidates , throughout the campaign .
#Text=We now interview independent Presidential candidate Frank Moore , a performance artist .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why do you want to be President ?
#Text=I have been running for president for about a year now .

#Text=I started running basically because none of the prominent candidates are talking honestly and directly about the state of things , are committed to fundamental change , and have a clear plan to create a humane , sustainable , and just plain enjoyable society .
#Text=So I took on that role .
#Text=When everyday people in the “ real world ” hear about my candidacy , they become extremely excited .
#Text=They do n’t see a performance artist in a wheelchair .
#Text=They do n’t check the odds of my winning .
#Text=Instead they see someone who they could excitedly vote for … somebody who shares their dreams , talks deeply about what really affects their lives .
#Text=And then they read my platform .

#Text=Then they got more excited at how possible it is to bring our dreams for our society into reality … to remove fear and isolation ; to get the boot of big corporations off our neck ; to provide everyone health care , life-long education , a minimum income , and a livable wage ; to restore our rights and freedoms ; and to bring our troops home now !
#Text=We everyday people know the real state of the union !
#Text=But more importantly , we have the sense of what is possible !
#Text=We need leaders who share our dreams and who do not sell us short .
#Text=Or sell us out !
#Text=I am running to raise the bar , to raise expectations , to expand the possibilities , to replace fear with hope and joy .
#Text=I am running because what we want is within our grasp .
#Text=I am running to get results .
#Text=Things can work .
#Text=Truth is political power is based on things not working .
#Text=This is why things do not work .
#Text=I am not running for political power , but to get things to work .
#Text=That simple !
#Text=Have you ever run for political office before ?
#Text=Have you ever been a member of a political party ?
#Text=Have you ever campaigned for another political candidate ?
#Text=Well , the only thing I ran for before was president of the student government in college .
#Text=I almost won…which freaked the other candidate out because he had spent $ 900 , while I spent $ 25 !
#Text=This is the same story in this campaign .
#Text=The only public office I have held is when I was appointed to the rent board in Santa Fe after a successful rent strike in the early 70 ’s .
#Text=I helped to found the San Bernardino chapter of the Peace and Freedom Party in the late 60 ’s .
